title: Ticket #4871: Allow -notify_user to be set in condor_submit_dag
description: Tom Downes just pointed out that -notify_user is not available on the condor_submit_dag command line. I'm also wondering whether we should have config macros specific to DAGMan for -notification and -notify_user.
remarks:
2015-Sep-22 13:28:12 by tpdownes:
I've setup Condor 8.2.6 according to the most recent suggestions from the Condor team and have notifications working again. I am curious about the behavior under DAGs, which is not obvious to me from the manual.

Let's say a user submits a DAG with jobs each of which have this in its submit file:

notification = Complete notify_user = thomas.downes@ligo.org

Further suppose that DAGMAN_SUPPRESS_NOTIFICATION is not set globally or locally and reverts to its default value of True. The entry in the manual for this variable states "Defaults to True, implementing behavior in which the user receives one notification email when the condor_dagman job completes, rather than thousands of notifications from each of the jobs submitted by condor_dagman." This is suggestive that the DAG-handled submission of a job with notifications enabled will create a notification at the end of the DAG run irrespective of the settings used in condor_submit_dag or in the file.dag.condor.sub file created by condor_submit_dag.

# RESPONSE FROM KENT #Hmm -- the language in the DAGMAN_SUPPRESS_NOTIFICATION documentation #is incorrect. The DAGMAN_SUPPRESS_NOTIFICATION setting doesn't have any effect #on whether you get a notification email for the DAGMan job itself, and that defaults to #never.

However, empirically, I don't believe that a notification is generated unless . I do see the ability to manually set "-notification" to condor_submit_dag but I don't see a corresponding "-notify_user" setting. How is one supposed to set these values for the DAG?

Is this the recommended path to generate a post-DAG notification to a user-specified e-mail address?

1. condor_submit_dag -no_submit file.dag 2. Add 2 lines noted above to job ClassAd in "file.dag.condor.sub" 3. condor_submit file.dag.condor.sub

That works as it ought to, but it seems like there are 2 too many steps.

# RESPONSE FROM KENT #Yes, you're right. There are two or three problems here: # #1) The language in the DAGMAN_SUPPRESS_NOTIFICATION section is misleading. #2) There should be a way to set notify_user in condor_submit_dag. Probably just adding a -notify_user argument is the way to go. #3) I wonder if -notification should default to always for DAGs. Or maybe there should be config macros for -notification and -notify_user?

2015-Sep-22 13:38:53 by tpdownes:
In-person conversation with Kent suggest following actions:

  1. -notify_user argument to condor_submit_dag
  2. DAGMAN_NOTIFICATION DAG config entry
  3. DAGMAN_NOTIFY_USER DAG config entry

Open questions:

  1. Should notification-related DAG config entries actually be keywords in .dag file so that they are more "user facing"?
  2. Should condor_dagman "inherit" the notification settings of its jobs following some rules? For example, if any job sets notification != Never, to inherit that value for the condor_dagman job?
